27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: i915_guc_submission.c,v 1.8 2018/08/27 15:09:35 riastradh Exp $");
28
29#include <linux/bitmap.h>
30#include <linux/firmware.h>
31#include <linux/circ_buf.h>
32#include <asm/cpufeature.h>
33#include "i915_drv.h"
34#include "intel_drv.h"
35#include "intel_guc.h"
36
37/**
38 * DOC: GuC Client
39 *
40 * i915_guc_client:
41 * We use the term client to avoid confusion with contexts. A i915_guc_client is
42 * equivalent to GuC object guc_context_desc. This context descriptor is
43 * allocated from a pool of 1024 entries. Kernel driver will allocate doorbell
44 * and workqueue for it. Also the process descriptor (guc_process_desc), which
45 * is mapped to client space. So the client can write Work Item then ring the
46 * doorbell.
47 *
48 * To simplify the implementation, we allocate one gem object that contains all
49 * pages for doorbell, process descriptor and workqueue.
50 *
51 * The Scratch registers:
52 * There are 16 MMIO-based registers start from 0xC180. The kernel driver writes
53 * a value to the action register (SOFT_SCRATCH_0) along with any data. It then
54 * triggers an interrupt on the GuC via another register write (0xC4C8).
55 * Firmware writes a success/fail code back to the action register after
56 * processes the request. The kernel driver polls waiting for this update and
57 * then proceeds.
58 * See host2guc_action()
59 *
60 * Doorbells:
61 * Doorbells are interrupts to uKernel. A doorbell is a single cache line (QW)
62 * mapped into process space.
63 *
64 * Work Items:
65 * There are several types of work items that the host may place into a
66 * workqueue, each with its own requirements and limitations. Currently only
67 * WQ_TYPE_INORDER is needed to support legacy submission via GuC, which
68 * represents in-order queue. The kernel driver packs ring tail pointer and an
69 * ELSP context descriptor dword into Work Item.
70 * See guc_add_workqueue_item()
71 *
72 */
73
74/*
75 * Read GuC command/status register (SOFT_SCRATCH_0)
76 * Return true if it contains a response rather than a command
77 */
78static inline bool host2guc_action_response(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
79 u32 *status)
80{
81 u32 val = I915_READ(SOFT_SCRATCH(0));
82 *status = val;
83 return GUC2HOST_IS_RESPONSE(val);
84}
85
86static int host2guc_action(struct intel_guc *guc, u32 *data, u32 len)
87{
88 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = guc_to_i915(guc);
89 u32 status;
90 int i;
91 int ret;
92
93 if (WARN_ON(len < 1 || len > 15))
94 return -EINVAL;
95
96 intel_uncore_forcewake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
97 spin_lock(&dev_priv->guc.host2guc_lock);
98
99 dev_priv->guc.action_count += 1;
100 dev_priv->guc.action_cmd = data[0];
101
102 for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
103 I915_WRITE(SOFT_SCRATCH(i), data[i]);
104
105 POSTING_READ(SOFT_SCRATCH(i - 1));
106
107 I915_WRITE(HOST2GUC_INTERRUPT, HOST2GUC_TRIGGER);
108
109 /* No HOST2GUC command should take longer than 10ms */
110 ret = wait_for_atomic(host2guc_action_response(dev_priv, &status), 10);
111 if (status != GUC2HOST_STATUS_SUCCESS) {
112 /*
113 * Either the GuC explicitly returned an error (which
114 * we convert to -EIO here) or no response at all was
115 * received within the timeout limit (-ETIMEDOUT)
116 */
117 if (ret != -ETIMEDOUT)
118 ret = -EIO;
119
120 DRM_ERROR("GUC: host2guc action 0x%X failed. ret=%d "
121 "status=0x%08X response=0x%08X\n",
122 data[0], ret, status,
123 I915_READ(SOFT_SCRATCH(15)));
124
125 dev_priv->guc.action_fail += 1;
126 dev_priv->guc.action_err = ret;
127 }
128 dev_priv->guc.action_status = status;
129
130 spin_unlock(&dev_priv->guc.host2guc_lock);
131 intel_uncore_forcewake_put(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
132
133 return ret;
134}
135
136/*
137 * Tell the GuC to allocate or deallocate a specific doorbell
138 */
139
140static int host2guc_allocate_doorbell(struct intel_guc *guc,
141 struct i915_guc_client *client)
142{
143 u32 data[2];
144
145 data[0] = HOST2GUC_ACTION_ALLOCATE_DOORBELL;
146 data[1] = client->ctx_index;
147
148 return host2guc_action(guc, data, 2);
149}
150
151static int host2guc_release_doorbell(struct intel_guc *guc,
152 struct i915_guc_client *client)
153{
154 u32 data[2];
155
156 data[0] = HOST2GUC_ACTION_DEALLOCATE_DOORBELL;
157 data[1] = client->ctx_index;
158
159 return host2guc_action(guc, data, 2);
160}
161
162static int host2guc_sample_forcewake(struct intel_guc *guc,
163 struct i915_guc_client *client)
164{
165 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = guc_to_i915(guc);
166 struct drm_device *dev = dev_priv->dev;
167 u32 data[2];
168
169 data[0] = HOST2GUC_ACTION_SAMPLE_FORCEWAKE;
170 /* WaRsDisableCoarsePowerGating:skl,bxt */
171 if (!intel_enable_rc6(dev_priv->dev) ||
172 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) < BXT_REVID_B0)) ||
173 (IS_SKL_GT3(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_E0)) ||
174 (IS_SKL_GT4(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_E0)))
175 data[1] = 0;
176 else
177 /* bit 0 and 1 are for Render and Media domain separately */
178 data[1] = GUC_FORCEWAKE_RENDER | GUC_FORCEWAKE_MEDIA;
179
180 return host2guc_action(guc, data, ARRAY_SIZE(data));
181}
182
183/*
184 * Initialise, update, or clear doorbell data shared with the GuC
185 *
186 * These functions modify shared data and so need access to the mapped
187 * client object which contains the page being used for the doorbell
188 */
189
190static void guc_init_doorbell(struct intel_guc *guc,
191 struct i915_guc_client *client)
192{
193 struct guc_doorbell_info *doorbell;
194 void *base;
195
196 base = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(client->client_obj, 0));
197 doorbell = (void *)((char *)base + client->doorbell_offset);
198
199 doorbell->db_status = 1;
200 doorbell->cookie = 0;
201
202 kunmap_atomic(base);
203}
204
205static int guc_ring_doorbell(struct i915_guc_client *gc)
206{
207 struct guc_process_desc *desc;
208 union guc_doorbell_qw db_cmp, db_exc, db_ret;
209 union guc_doorbell_qw *db;
210 void *base;
211 int attempt = 2, ret = -EAGAIN;
212
213 base = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(gc->client_obj, 0));
214 desc = (void *)((char *)base + gc->proc_desc_offset);
215
216 /* Update the tail so it is visible to GuC */
217 desc->tail = gc->wq_tail;
218
219 /* current cookie */
220 db_cmp.db_status = GUC_DOORBELL_ENABLED;
221 db_cmp.cookie = gc->cookie;
222
223 /* cookie to be updated */
224 db_exc.db_status = GUC_DOORBELL_ENABLED;
225 db_exc.cookie = gc->cookie + 1;
226 if (db_exc.cookie == 0)
227 db_exc.cookie = 1;
228
229 /* pointer of current doorbell cacheline */
230 db = (void *)((char *)base + gc->doorbell_offset);
231
232 while (attempt--) {
233 /* lets ring the doorbell */
234 db_ret.value_qw = atomic64_cmpxchg((atomic64_t *)db,
235 db_cmp.value_qw, db_exc.value_qw);
236
237 /* if the exchange was successfully executed */
238 if (db_ret.value_qw == db_cmp.value_qw) {
239 /* db was successfully rung */
240 gc->cookie = db_exc.cookie;
241 ret = 0;
242 break;
243 }
244
245 /* XXX: doorbell was lost and need to acquire it again */
246 if (db_ret.db_status == GUC_DOORBELL_DISABLED)
247 break;
248
249 DRM_ERROR("Cookie mismatch. Expected %d, returned %d\n",
250 db_cmp.cookie, db_ret.cookie);
251
252 /* update the cookie to newly read cookie from GuC */
253 db_cmp.cookie = db_ret.cookie;
254 db_exc.cookie = db_ret.cookie + 1;
255 if (db_exc.cookie == 0)
256 db_exc.cookie = 1;
257 }
258
259 kunmap_atomic(base);
260 return ret;
261}
262
263static void guc_disable_doorbell(struct intel_guc *guc,
264 struct i915_guc_client *client)
265{
266 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = guc_to_i915(guc);
267 struct guc_doorbell_info *doorbell;
268 void *base;
269 int drbreg = GEN8_DRBREGL(client->doorbell_id);
270 int value;
271
272 base = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(client->client_obj, 0));
273 doorbell = (void *)((char *)base + client->doorbell_offset);
274
275 doorbell->db_status = 0;
276
277 kunmap_atomic(base);
278
279 I915_WRITE(drbreg, I915_READ(drbreg) & ~GEN8_DRB_VALID);
280
281 value = I915_READ(drbreg);
282 WARN_ON((value & GEN8_DRB_VALID) != 0);
283
284 I915_WRITE(GEN8_DRBREGU(client->doorbell_id), 0);
285 I915_WRITE(drbreg, 0);
286
287 /* XXX: wait for any interrupts */
288 /* XXX: wait for workqueue to drain */
289}
290
291/*
292 * Select, assign and relase doorbell cachelines
293 *
294 * These functions track which doorbell cachelines are in use.
295 * The data they manipulate is protected by the host2guc lock.
296 */
297
298static uint32_t select_doorbell_cacheline(struct intel_guc *guc)
299{
300 const uint32_t cacheline_size = cache_line_size();
301 uint32_t offset;
302
303 spin_lock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
304
305 /* Doorbell uses a single cache line within a page */
306 offset = offset_in_page(guc->db_cacheline);
307
308 /* Moving to next cache line to reduce contention */
309 guc->db_cacheline += cacheline_size;
310
311 spin_unlock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
312
313 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("selected doorbell cacheline 0x%x, next 0x%x, linesize %u\n",
314 offset, guc->db_cacheline, cacheline_size);
315
316 return offset;
317}
318
319static uint16_t assign_doorbell(struct intel_guc *guc, uint32_t priority)
320{
321 /*
322 * The bitmap is split into two halves; the first half is used for
323 * normal priority contexts, the second half for high-priority ones.
324 * Note that logically higher priorities are numerically less than
325 * normal ones, so the test below means "is it high-priority?"
326 */
327 const bool hi_pri = (priority <= GUC_CTX_PRIORITY_HIGH);
328 const uint16_t half = GUC_MAX_DOORBELLS / 2;
329 const uint16_t start = hi_pri ? half : 0;
330 const uint16_t end = start + half;
331 uint16_t id;
332
333 spin_lock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
334 id = find_next_zero_bit(guc->doorbell_bitmap, end, start);
335 if (id == end)
336 id = GUC_INVALID_DOORBELL_ID;
337 else
338 bitmap_set(guc->doorbell_bitmap, id, 1);
339 spin_unlock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
340
341 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("assigned %s priority doorbell id 0x%x\n",
342 hi_pri ? "high" : "normal", id);
343
344 return id;
345}
346
347static void release_doorbell(struct intel_guc *guc, uint16_t id)
348{
349 spin_lock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
350 bitmap_clear(guc->doorbell_bitmap, id, 1);
351 spin_unlock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
352}
353
354/*
355 * Initialise the process descriptor shared with the GuC firmware.
356 */
357static void guc_init_proc_desc(struct intel_guc *guc,
358 struct i915_guc_client *client)
359{
360 struct guc_process_desc *desc;
361 void *base;
362
363 base = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(client->client_obj, 0));
364 desc = (void *)((char *)base + client->proc_desc_offset);
365
366 memset(desc, 0, sizeof(*desc));
367
368 /*
369 * XXX: pDoorbell and WQVBaseAddress are pointers in process address
370 * space for ring3 clients (set them as in mmap_ioctl) or kernel
371 * space for kernel clients (map on demand instead? May make debug
372 * easier to have it mapped).
373 */
374 desc->wq_base_addr = 0;
375 desc->db_base_addr = 0;
376
377 desc->context_id = client->ctx_index;
378 desc->wq_size_bytes = client->wq_size;
379 desc->wq_status = WQ_STATUS_ACTIVE;
380 desc->priority = client->priority;
381
382 kunmap_atomic(base);
383}
384
385/*
386 * Initialise/clear the context descriptor shared with the GuC firmware.
387 *
388 * This descriptor tells the GuC where (in GGTT space) to find the important
389 * data structures relating to this client (doorbell, process descriptor,
390 * write queue, etc).
391 */
392
393static void guc_init_ctx_desc(struct intel_guc *guc,
394 struct i915_guc_client *client)
395{
396 struct intel_context *ctx = client->owner;
397 struct guc_context_desc desc;
398#ifndef __NetBSD__
399 struct sg_table *sg;
400#endif
401 int i;
402
403 memset(&desc, 0, sizeof(desc));
404
405 desc.attribute = GUC_CTX_DESC_ATTR_ACTIVE | GUC_CTX_DESC_ATTR_KERNEL;
406 desc.context_id = client->ctx_index;
407 desc.priority = client->priority;
408 desc.db_id = client->doorbell_id;
409
410 for (i = 0; i < I915_NUM_RINGS; i++) {
411 struct guc_execlist_context *lrc = &desc.lrc[i];
412 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = ctx->engine[i].ringbuf;
413 struct intel_engine_cs *ring;
414 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
415 uint64_t ctx_desc;
416
417 /* TODO: We have a design issue to be solved here. Only when we
418 * receive the first batch, we know which engine is used by the
419 * user. But here GuC expects the lrc and ring to be pinned. It
420 * is not an issue for default context, which is the only one
421 * for now who owns a GuC client. But for future owner of GuC
422 * client, need to make sure lrc is pinned prior to enter here.
423 */
424 obj = ctx->engine[i].state;
425 if (!obj)
426 break; /* XXX: continue? */
427
428 ring = ringbuf->ring;
429 ctx_desc = intel_lr_context_descriptor(ctx, ring);
430 lrc->context_desc = (u32)ctx_desc;
431
432 /* The state page is after PPHWSP */
433 lrc->ring_lcra = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj) +
434 LRC_STATE_PN * PAGE_SIZE;
435 lrc->context_id = (client->ctx_index << GUC_ELC_CTXID_OFFSET) |
436 (ring->id << GUC_ELC_ENGINE_OFFSET);
437
438 obj = ringbuf->obj;
439
440 lrc->ring_begin = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj);
441 lrc->ring_end = lrc->ring_begin + obj->base.size - 1;
442 lrc->ring_next_free_location = lrc->ring_begin;
443 lrc->ring_current_tail_pointer_value = 0;
444
445 desc.engines_used |= (1 << ring->id);
446 }
447
448 WARN_ON(desc.engines_used == 0);
449
450 /*
451 * The CPU address is only needed at certain points, so kmap_atomic on
452 * demand instead of storing it in the ctx descriptor.
453 * XXX: May make debug easier to have it mapped
454 */
455 desc.db_trigger_cpu = 0;
456 desc.db_trigger_uk = client->doorbell_offset +
457 i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(client->client_obj);
458#ifdef __NetBSD__
459 desc.db_trigger_phy = client->doorbell_offset +
460 client->client_obj->pages->dm_segs[0].ds_addr;
461#else
462 desc.db_trigger_phy = client->doorbell_offset +
463 sg_dma_address(client->client_obj->pages->sgl);
464#endif
465
466 desc.process_desc = client->proc_desc_offset +
467 i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(client->client_obj);
468
469 desc.wq_addr = client->wq_offset +
470 i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(client->client_obj);
471
472 desc.wq_size = client->wq_size;
473
474 /*
475 * XXX: Take LRCs from an existing intel_context if this is not an
476 * IsKMDCreatedContext client
477 */
478 desc.desc_private = (uintptr_t)client;
479
480 /* Pool context is pinned already */
481#ifdef __NetBSD__
482 size_t skip = sizeof(desc) * client->ctx_index;
483 size_t resid = sizeof(desc);
484 struct vm_page *page;
485 const char *src = (void *)&desc;
486 char *dst;
487 size_t n;
488
489 /* XXX Can't use uiomove because it can fail. */
490 TAILQ_FOREACH(page, &guc->ctx_pool_obj->pageq, pageq.queue) {
491 if (skip >= PAGE_SIZE) {
492 skip -= PAGE_SIZE;
493 continue;
494 }
495 dst = kmap_atomic(container_of(page, struct page, p_vmp));
496 n = MIN(PAGE_SIZE - skip, resid);
497 memcpy(dst + skip, src, n);
498 kunmap_atomic(dst);
499 skip = 0;
500 src += n;
501 resid -= n;
502 if (resid == 0)
503 break;
504 }
505#else
506 sg = guc->ctx_pool_obj->pages;
507 sg_pcopy_from_buffer(sg->sgl, sg->nents, &desc, sizeof(desc),
508 sizeof(desc) * client->ctx_index);
509#endif
510}
511
512static void guc_fini_ctx_desc(struct intel_guc *guc,
513 struct i915_guc_client *client)
514{
515#ifdef __NetBSD__
516 struct guc_context_desc desc;
517 size_t skip = sizeof(desc) * client->ctx_index;
518 size_t resid = sizeof(desc);
519 struct vm_page *page;
520 const char *src = (void *)&desc;
521 char *dst;
522 size_t n;
523
524 memset(&desc, 0, sizeof(desc));
525
526 /* XXX Can't use uiomove because it can fail. */
527 TAILQ_FOREACH(page, &guc->ctx_pool_obj->pageq, pageq.queue) {
528 if (skip >= PAGE_SIZE) {
529 skip -= PAGE_SIZE;
530 continue;
531 }
532 dst = kmap_atomic(container_of(page, struct page, p_vmp));
533 n = MIN(PAGE_SIZE - skip, resid);
534 memcpy(dst + skip, src, n);
535 kunmap_atomic(dst);
536 skip = 0;
537 src += n;
538 resid -= n;
539 if (resid == 0)
540 break;
541 }
542#else
543 struct guc_context_desc desc;
544 struct sg_table *sg;
545
546 memset(&desc, 0, sizeof(desc));
547
548 sg = guc->ctx_pool_obj->pages;
549 sg_pcopy_from_buffer(sg->sgl, sg->nents, &desc, sizeof(desc),
550 sizeof(desc) * client->ctx_index);
551#endif
552}
553
554/* Get valid workqueue item and return it back to offset */
555static int guc_get_workqueue_space(struct i915_guc_client *gc, u32 *offset)
556{
557 struct guc_process_desc *desc;
558 void *base;
559 u32 size = sizeof(struct guc_wq_item);
560 int ret = 0, timeout_counter = 200;
561
562 base = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(gc->client_obj, 0));
563 desc = (void *)((char *)base + gc->proc_desc_offset);
564
565 while (timeout_counter-- > 0) {
566 ret = wait_for_atomic(CIRC_SPACE(gc->wq_tail, desc->head,
567 gc->wq_size) >= size, 1);
568
569 if (!ret) {
570 *offset = gc->wq_tail;
571
572 /* advance the tail for next workqueue item */
573 gc->wq_tail += size;
574 gc->wq_tail &= gc->wq_size - 1;
575
576 /* this will break the loop */
577 timeout_counter = 0;
578 }
579 };
580
581 kunmap_atomic(base);
582
583 return ret;
584}
585
586static int guc_add_workqueue_item(struct i915_guc_client *gc,
587 struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq)
588{
589 enum intel_ring_id ring_id = rq->ring->id;
590 struct guc_wq_item *wqi;
591 void *base;
592 u32 tail, wq_len, wq_off = 0;
593 int ret;
594
595 ret = guc_get_workqueue_space(gc, &wq_off);
596 if (ret)
597 return ret;
598
599 /* For now workqueue item is 4 DWs; workqueue buffer is 2 pages. So we
600 * should not have the case where structure wqi is across page, neither
601 * wrapped to the beginning. This simplifies the implementation below.
602 *
603 * XXX: if not the case, we need save data to a temp wqi and copy it to
604 * workqueue buffer dw by dw.
605 */
606 WARN_ON(sizeof(struct guc_wq_item) != 16);
607 WARN_ON(wq_off & 3);
608
609 /* wq starts from the page after doorbell / process_desc */
610 base = kmap_atomic(i915_gem_object_get_page(gc->client_obj,
611 (wq_off + GUC_DB_SIZE) >> PAGE_SHIFT));
612 wq_off &= PAGE_SIZE - 1;
613 wqi = (struct guc_wq_item *)((char *)base + wq_off);
614
615 /* len does not include the header */
616 wq_len = sizeof(struct guc_wq_item) / sizeof(u32) - 1;
617 wqi->header = WQ_TYPE_INORDER |
618 (wq_len << WQ_LEN_SHIFT) |
619 (ring_id << WQ_TARGET_SHIFT) |
620 WQ_NO_WCFLUSH_WAIT;
621
622 /* The GuC wants only the low-order word of the context descriptor */
623 wqi->context_desc = (u32)intel_lr_context_descriptor(rq->ctx, rq->ring);
624
625 /* The GuC firmware wants the tail index in QWords, not bytes */
626 tail = rq->ringbuf->tail >> 3;
627 wqi->ring_tail = tail << WQ_RING_TAIL_SHIFT;
628 wqi->fence_id = 0; /*XXX: what fence to be here */
629
630 kunmap_atomic(base);
631
632 return 0;
633}
634
635#define CTX_RING_BUFFER_START 0x08
636
637/* Update the ringbuffer pointer in a saved context image */
638static void lr_context_update(struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq)
639{
640 enum intel_ring_id ring_id = rq->ring->id;
641 struct drm_i915_gem_object *ctx_obj = rq->ctx->engine[ring_id].state;
642 struct drm_i915_gem_object *rb_obj = rq->ringbuf->obj;
643 struct page *page;
644 uint32_t *reg_state;
645
646 BUG_ON(!ctx_obj);
647 WARN_ON(!i915_gem_obj_is_pinned(ctx_obj));
648 WARN_ON(!i915_gem_obj_is_pinned(rb_obj));
649
650 page = i915_gem_object_get_page(ctx_obj, LRC_STATE_PN);
651 reg_state = kmap_atomic(page);
652
653 reg_state[CTX_RING_BUFFER_START+1] = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(rb_obj);
654
655 kunmap_atomic(reg_state);
656}
657
658/**
659 * i915_guc_submit() - Submit commands through GuC
660 * @client: the guc client where commands will go through
661 * @ctx: LRC where commands come from
662 * @ring: HW engine that will excute the commands
663 *
664 * Return: 0 if succeed
665 */
666int i915_guc_submit(struct i915_guc_client *client,
667 struct drm_i915_gem_request *rq)
668{
669 struct intel_guc *guc = client->guc;
670 enum intel_ring_id ring_id = rq->ring->id;
671 unsigned long flags;
672 int q_ret, b_ret;
673
674 /* Need this because of the deferred pin ctx and ring */
675 /* Shall we move this right after ring is pinned? */
676 lr_context_update(rq);
677
678 spin_lock_irqsave(&client->wq_lock, flags);
679
680 q_ret = guc_add_workqueue_item(client, rq);
681 if (q_ret == 0)
682 b_ret = guc_ring_doorbell(client);
683
684 client->submissions[ring_id] += 1;
685 if (q_ret) {
686 client->q_fail += 1;
687 client->retcode = q_ret;
688 } else if (b_ret) {
689 client->b_fail += 1;
690 client->retcode = q_ret = b_ret;
691 } else {
692 client->retcode = 0;
693 }
694 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&client->wq_lock, flags);
695
696 spin_lock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
697 guc->submissions[ring_id] += 1;
698 guc->last_seqno[ring_id] = rq->seqno;
699 spin_unlock(&guc->host2guc_lock);
700
701 return q_ret;
702}
703
704/*
705 * Everything below here is concerned with setup & teardown, and is
706 * therefore not part of the somewhat time-critical batch-submission
707 * path of i915_guc_submit() above.
708 */
709
710/**
711 * gem_allocate_guc_obj() - Allocate gem object for GuC usage
712 * @dev: drm device
713 * @size: size of object
714 *
715 * This is a wrapper to create a gem obj. In order to use it inside GuC, the
716 * object needs to be pinned lifetime. Also we must pin it to gtt space other
717 * than [0, GUC_WOPCM_TOP) because this range is reserved inside GuC.
718 *
719 * Return: A drm_i915_gem_object if successful, otherwise NULL.
720 */
721static struct drm_i915_gem_object *gem_allocate_guc_obj(struct drm_device *dev,
722 u32 size)
723{
724 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
725 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
726
727 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, size);
728 if (!obj)
729 return NULL;
730
731 if (i915_gem_object_get_pages(obj)) {
732 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
733 return NULL;
734 }
735
736 if (i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(obj, PAGE_SIZE,
737 PIN_OFFSET_BIAS | GUC_WOPCM_TOP)) {
738 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
739 return NULL;
740 }
741
742 /* Invalidate GuC TLB to let GuC take the latest updates to GTT. */
743 I915_WRITE(GEN8_GTCR, GEN8_GTCR_INVALIDATE);
744
745 return obj;
746}
747
748/**
749 * gem_release_guc_obj() - Release gem object allocated for GuC usage
750 * @obj: gem obj to be released
751 */
752static void gem_release_guc_obj(struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj)
753{
754 if (!obj)
755 return;
756
757 if (i915_gem_obj_is_pinned(obj))
758 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(obj);
759
760 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
761}
762
763static void guc_client_free(struct drm_device *dev,
764 struct i915_guc_client *client)
765{
766 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
767 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
768
769 if (!client)
770 return;
771
772 if (client->doorbell_id != GUC_INVALID_DOORBELL_ID) {
773 /*
774 * First disable the doorbell, then tell the GuC we've
775 * finished with it, finally deallocate it in our bitmap
776 */
777 guc_disable_doorbell(guc, client);
778 host2guc_release_doorbell(guc, client);
779 release_doorbell(guc, client->doorbell_id);
780 }
781
782 /*
783 * XXX: wait for any outstanding submissions before freeing memory.
784 * Be sure to drop any locks
785 */
786
787 gem_release_guc_obj(client->client_obj);
788
789 if (client->ctx_index != GUC_INVALID_CTX_ID) {
790 guc_fini_ctx_desc(guc, client);
791 ida_simple_remove(&guc->ctx_ids, client->ctx_index);
792 }
793
794 kfree(client);
795}
796
797/**
798 * guc_client_alloc() - Allocate an i915_guc_client
799 * @dev: drm device
800 * @priority: four levels priority _CRITICAL, _HIGH, _NORMAL and _LOW
801 * The kernel client to replace ExecList submission is created with
802 * NORMAL priority. Priority of a client for scheduler can be HIGH,
803 * while a preemption context can use CRITICAL.
804 * @ctx the context to own the client (we use the default render context)
805 *
806 * Return: An i915_guc_client object if success.
807 */
808static struct i915_guc_client *guc_client_alloc(struct drm_device *dev,
809 uint32_t priority,
810 struct intel_context *ctx)
811{
812 struct i915_guc_client *client;
813 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
814 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
815 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
816
817 client = kzalloc(sizeof(*client), GFP_KERNEL);
818 if (!client)
819 return NULL;
820
821 client->doorbell_id = GUC_INVALID_DOORBELL_ID;
822 client->priority = priority;
823 client->owner = ctx;
824 client->guc = guc;
825
826 client->ctx_index = (uint32_t)ida_simple_get(&guc->ctx_ids, 0,
827 GUC_MAX_GPU_CONTEXTS, GFP_KERNEL);
828 if (client->ctx_index >= GUC_MAX_GPU_CONTEXTS) {
829 client->ctx_index = GUC_INVALID_CTX_ID;
830 goto err;
831 }
832
833 /* The first page is doorbell/proc_desc. Two followed pages are wq. */
834 obj = gem_allocate_guc_obj(dev, GUC_DB_SIZE + GUC_WQ_SIZE);
835 if (!obj)
836 goto err;
837
838 client->client_obj = obj;
839 client->wq_offset = GUC_DB_SIZE;
840 client->wq_size = GUC_WQ_SIZE;
841 spin_lock_init(&client->wq_lock);
842
843 client->doorbell_offset = select_doorbell_cacheline(guc);
844
845 /*
846 * Since the doorbell only requires a single cacheline, we can save
847 * space by putting the application process descriptor in the same
848 * page. Use the half of the page that doesn't include the doorbell.
849 */
850 if (client->doorbell_offset >= (GUC_DB_SIZE / 2))
851 client->proc_desc_offset = 0;
852 else
853 client->proc_desc_offset = (GUC_DB_SIZE / 2);
854
855 client->doorbell_id = assign_doorbell(guc, client->priority);
856 if (client->doorbell_id == GUC_INVALID_DOORBELL_ID)
857 /* XXX: evict a doorbell instead */
858 goto err;
859
860 guc_init_proc_desc(guc, client);
861 guc_init_ctx_desc(guc, client);
862 guc_init_doorbell(guc, client);
863
864 /* XXX: Any cache flushes needed? General domain mgmt calls? */
865
866 if (host2guc_allocate_doorbell(guc, client))
867 goto err;
868
869 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("new priority %u client %p: ctx_index %u db_id %u\n",
870 priority, client, client->ctx_index, client->doorbell_id);
871
872 return client;
873
874err:
875 DRM_ERROR("FAILED to create priority %u GuC client!\n", priority);
876
877 guc_client_free(dev, client);
878 return NULL;
879}
880
881static void guc_create_log(struct intel_guc *guc)
882{
883 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = guc_to_i915(guc);
884 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
885 unsigned long offset;
886 uint32_t size, flags;
887
888 if (i915.guc_log_level < GUC_LOG_VERBOSITY_MIN)
889 return;
890
891 if (i915.guc_log_level > GUC_LOG_VERBOSITY_MAX)
892 i915.guc_log_level = GUC_LOG_VERBOSITY_MAX;
893
894 /* The first page is to save log buffer state. Allocate one
895 * extra page for others in case for overlap */
896 size = (1 + GUC_LOG_DPC_PAGES + 1 +
897 GUC_LOG_ISR_PAGES + 1 +
898 GUC_LOG_CRASH_PAGES + 1) << PAGE_SHIFT;
899
900 obj = guc->log_obj;
901 if (!obj) {
902 obj = gem_allocate_guc_obj(dev_priv->dev, size);
903 if (!obj) {
904 /* logging will be off */
905 i915.guc_log_level = -1;
906 return;
907 }
908
909 guc->log_obj = obj;
910 }
911
912 /* each allocated unit is a page */
913 flags = GUC_LOG_VALID | GUC_LOG_NOTIFY_ON_HALF_FULL |
914 (GUC_LOG_DPC_PAGES << GUC_LOG_DPC_SHIFT) |
915 (GUC_LOG_ISR_PAGES << GUC_LOG_ISR_SHIFT) |
916 (GUC_LOG_CRASH_PAGES << GUC_LOG_CRASH_SHIFT);
917
918 offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj) >> PAGE_SHIFT; /* in pages */
919 guc->log_flags = (offset << GUC_LOG_BUF_ADDR_SHIFT) | flags;
920}
921
922/*
923 * Set up the memory resources to be shared with the GuC. At this point,
924 * we require just one object that can be mapped through the GGTT.
925 */
926int i915_guc_submission_init(struct drm_device *dev)
927{
928 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
929 const size_t ctxsize = sizeof(struct guc_context_desc);
930 const size_t poolsize = GUC_MAX_GPU_CONTEXTS * ctxsize;
931 const size_t gemsize = round_up(poolsize, PAGE_SIZE);
932 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
933
934 if (!i915.enable_guc_submission)
935 return 0; /* not enabled */
936
937 if (guc->ctx_pool_obj)
938 return 0; /* already allocated */
939
940 guc->ctx_pool_obj = gem_allocate_guc_obj(dev_priv->dev, gemsize);
941 if (!guc->ctx_pool_obj)
942 return -ENOMEM;
943
944 spin_lock_init(&dev_priv->guc.host2guc_lock);
945
946 ida_init(&guc->ctx_ids);
947
948 guc_create_log(guc);
949
950 return 0;
951}
952
953int i915_guc_submission_enable(struct drm_device *dev)
954{
955 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
956 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
957 struct intel_context *ctx = dev_priv->ring[RCS].default_context;
958 struct i915_guc_client *client;
959
960 /* client for execbuf submission */
961 client = guc_client_alloc(dev, GUC_CTX_PRIORITY_KMD_NORMAL, ctx);
962 if (!client) {
963 DRM_ERROR("Failed to create execbuf guc_client\n");
964 return -ENOMEM;
965 }
966
967 guc->execbuf_client = client;
968
969 host2guc_sample_forcewake(guc, client);
970
971 return 0;
972}
973
974void i915_guc_submission_disable(struct drm_device *dev)
975{
976 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
977 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
978
979 guc_client_free(dev, guc->execbuf_client);
980 guc->execbuf_client = NULL;
981}
982
983void i915_guc_submission_fini(struct drm_device *dev)
984{
985 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
986 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
987
988 gem_release_guc_obj(dev_priv->guc.log_obj);
989 guc->log_obj = NULL;
990
991 if (guc->ctx_pool_obj)
992 ida_destroy(&guc->ctx_ids);
993 gem_release_guc_obj(guc->ctx_pool_obj);
994 guc->ctx_pool_obj = NULL;
995}
996
997/**
998 * intel_guc_suspend() - notify GuC entering suspend state
999 * @dev: drm device
1000 */
1001int intel_guc_suspend(struct drm_device *dev)
1002{
1003 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1004 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
1005 struct intel_context *ctx;
1006 u32 data[3];
1007
1008 if (!i915.enable_guc_submission)
1009 return 0;
1010
1011 ctx = dev_priv->ring[RCS].default_context;
1012
1013 data[0] = HOST2GUC_ACTION_ENTER_S_STATE;
1014 /* any value greater than GUC_POWER_D0 */
1015 data[1] = GUC_POWER_D1;
1016 /* first page is shared data with GuC */
1017 data[2] = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(ctx->engine[RCS].state);
1018
1019 return host2guc_action(guc, data, ARRAY_SIZE(data));
1020}
1021
1022
1023/**
1024 * intel_guc_resume() - notify GuC resuming from suspend state
1025 * @dev: drm device
1026 */
1027int intel_guc_resume(struct drm_device *dev)
1028{
1029 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1030 struct intel_guc *guc = &dev_priv->guc;
1031 struct intel_context *ctx;
1032 u32 data[3];
1033
1034 if (!i915.enable_guc_submission)
1035 return 0;
1036
1037 ctx = dev_priv->ring[RCS].default_context;
1038
1039 data[0] = HOST2GUC_ACTION_EXIT_S_STATE;
1040 data[1] = GUC_POWER_D0;
1041 /* first page is shared data with GuC */
1042 data[2] = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(ctx->engine[RCS].state);
1043
1044 return host2guc_action(guc, data, ARRAY_SIZE(data));
1045}
